In Fig. 2A, the effect of inhibitors on colchicine accumulation in different cell lines is shown. Colchicine uptake was measured after 60 minutes in CC531mdr+ cell lines, in the absence or presence of one of the following potential inhibitors: vinblastine (vbl) 100 µM, cyclosporine (cyclo) 50 µM, verapamil (vera) 100 µM, glibenclamide (gli) 100 µM, BM-208 (208) 100 µM, BM-223 (223) 100 µM. Which potential inhibitor has the highest colchicine accumulation?

a) vinblastine (vbl)
b) cyclosporine (cyclo)
c) verapamil (vera)
d) glibenclamide (gli)

b) vehicle 14f 2ml/kg ip plus ghrelin 10µg/rat icv
c) 14f 10mg/kg ip plus ghrelin10 µg/rat icv

ideal: b) vehicle 14f 2ml/kg ip plus ghrelin 10µg/rat icv
option: a) vehicle 14f ip 2 ml/kg plus ghrelin vehicle 15 µl/rat icv
b) vehicle 14f 2ml/kg ip plus ghrelin 10µg/rat icv
c) 14f 10mg/kg ip plus ghrelin10 µg/rat icv
